item.title: Hugo - **highlight** :art:
item.description: Hugo comes with reallly fast syntax highlighting from Chroma. From Hugo 0.28, the default syntax hightlighter in Hugo is Chroma; it is built in Go and is really, really fast – and for the most important parts compatible with Pygments. See https://gohugo.io/content-management/syntax-highlighting for more.

item.title: Emacs Jokes
item.description:
Richard M. Stallman (RMS, widely known for creating EMACS) is writing a UNIX clone called GNU (which means Gnu’s Not Unix–a recursive acronym).

This seems to open the way to a whole gnu class of jokes. For example:

item.title: Emacs - it all starts here
item.description:
Emacs originally was an acronym for Editor MACroS. RMS says he “picked the name Emacs because was not in use as an abbreviation on ITS at the time.”

The first Emacs was a set of macros written in 1976 at MIT by RMS for the editor TECO (Text Editor and COrrector, originally Tape Editor and COrrector) under ITS (the Incompatible Timesharing System) on a PDP-10.
